monogr.title: Ane breif gathering of the halie signes, sacrifices and sacramentis institutit of God sen the creation of the warlde. And of the trew originall of the sacrifice of the messe. Translatit out of Frenche into Scottis be ane faithful brother

div.head: THE AVTHOVR TO THE READER.
div.p:
QVHEN I considerit the controuersies rissin betwene yaim, quhilks cal yaim self Christianis, sume attempting to reteine ye vaine superstitioūs quhilks sue cedit to yaim fra yair Predecessours: sume alswa being in venters of new sectis, schismis, and heresies: & the vthers of fewer nomber being inspyrit and chosin of God, desiring to rute out the darknes of ignorance, to cause schyne the licht of the treuth: it apperis to me that the maist dangerous poysone, quhilk Satan vses to poysone men with the venome of seditione, hes bene drawin out of the deip dungioun of the Messe, colourit with ane gude end, and couerit with gude intention. And albeit that mony haif trauelit greatlie to discouer this rocke of mindes, be Descriptiouns, Anatomies, Centouns,Anatomies of the messe Centouns & clamped pecis. and Ingynes concerning the Messe: nottheles to vnderminde and contreminde, euer mair & mair this fortresse, quhilk semis vnwinnable, after I had red the seconde volume of the Elassopolitane commentaries, quhilks treatis of the nomber, dignitie, power, riches and of the constitutions of greit Bischoppis, hie Preistis and Sacrificers, sen the creatioun of the warlde, I haif drawin ane compendious treatise of the Sacrifice callit the Messe. In this litil treatise are declarit the halie signes, Sacrificis & Sacramentis ordenit be God fra tyme to tyme, of the corruptioūs croppin in successiuelie in the Kirk of God, and speciallie is descriuit the trew original of the Messe, for quhilk presentlie mē are fallin in greit contentiouns & debaits: for sume inuey is agains it as new forgit: other defend it be prescriptioun and lang possessioun. Swa be sick altercatiouns, the Christien Kirk is troublit throch ye scurge of seditioun. Bot gif thou haif pacience (ô faithful Reader) of quhat sect swaeuer thou be, Papist or Euange • ist, as thou redis this brief discours (tarying in the meane tyme quhil thou maie haif the buikis of the Commentaries in thair integritie) thou salt knaw trewlie quhat is the original of the Messe, partelie verie ancient, & partelie
verie new, quha are the founders thairof, augmenters, Doters, and Patrons. And to the end, that thou maie be assurit, that the stories are faithfullie gather it, that thou may haif recourse to the authours, out of ye quhilks, yai are drawin, thair Names and Buiks, are cotit in ye margent. I wil haulde the na langer, praying our gude God to inspire the after his halie wil, throch ye intercessioun of our onlie Sauiour, Mediatour, and redemer Iesus Christ.
